lines.text: What's the matter?
Come down here. Stick out your tongue.
All of it? Oh, Doctor...
Just as I thought.
Don't you want to examine me? I have some very nice symptoms...
Don't you ever find a middle-aged, unattractive suspect?
They're just facts in a case to me, Garda. I don't see them as girls. A detective's first thought must be of his case.
It's that second thought that worries me.
Come on, dear. You've got to get dressed.
Dressed for what?
Ah, well, you wouldn't want to get buried in that suit, would you?

[Leaving]
look, Darling, you order something. I'll be right back. I've got to see the manager. He distinctly promised me a room overlooking the ocean.
But this one overlooks the ocean.
But I don't like this ocean.
[He leaves]

[the Bellboy chuckles]
What's funny?
Nothing... only the last place I worked was an insane asylum. I was hoping this'd be a little different.

[In their crowded hotel suite]
Darling, do you think a rumor I have leprosy would get some of our guests to leave?
As far as I'm conccerned, it's more than a rumor.

[Finding a tape measure that she suspects will be used on the beauty pageant candidates]
And what were you going to measure with this, Mr. Sloane?
High tide.

[as they discover a girl's body on the floor]
Get a doctor quick!
It'd have to be a very good doctor, Chief. This girl's dead.

[to Joel and Sam Travers]
Well, you big town wise guys, I could lock you both up. You know that, don't yuh? And if either one of you interferes in this case again, I'll throw you in jail so far, it'll take a week to get beans to yuh! Now get out of here, both of you!

[On the phone]
I can't help it if Miss Los Angeles's bathing suit is too tight. Look at how Los Angeles has grown in the last few years!
Darling, do you think they'll go on with the pageant despite all this dreadful business?
I hope so.
You would, you and your tape measure.
Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. It's now my privilege to introduce, Miss Florabelle Higgins, Miss Tulsa, Oklahoma.
She ought to be Miss Tulsa. She's built like an oil well.
